Reviews.Title: “convenient”
Reviews.Author: Erna D Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in a quite surrounding; nice to have after a busy visit at the center of London. Small supermarkets and resturants in the near surrounding. Close to a tube station. With the tube it is 15 minutes to Convent Garden e.g. In the hotel there is no elevator. It is good to know that if you are not able to use the stairs. There is no nightconcierge in the hotel after 00.00 midnight. So if you arrive quite early (e.g.before 11.00 hrs) you have to arrange a key if you want to come in after midnight again. It is a nice middleclass hotel with a good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “well worth the money”
Reviews.Author: dorothy39
Reviews.Content: We go to London two or three times a year and have gradually seen ourselves priced out of the market on the hotel front. However we found The Mentone on the internet and gave it a try. It was well worth the money. For £100 per night two of us had a clean quiet, nicely furnished room with tea and coffee making facilities, a lovely breakfast and a spotless shower en suite. Its location could not be better. A few minutes walk from Kings Cross and a short walk to Woburn Street with all its busses to all parts of London. Staff could not have been friendlier. It is a no frills hotel so we had to borrow (at no extra cost) a hairdrier, and there was no lift which may or may not be a problem.as the hotel only had three floors. We were able to leave luggage at the end of our stay until it was time to collect it for our return journey up north. We will definitely use The Mentone again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, normal B&B”
Reviews.Author: Wizou
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a few days on a business trip to University College, around the corner. Location perfect, near Metro and large railway stations. Rooms nicely refurbished, clean and well lit but very noisy, from other rooms mainly. Service minimal, breakfast romm gloomy, with very basic English breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in the city Good customer service.”
Reviews.Author: TommyBunz
Reviews.Content: I stated in London for the 8 days and it was good value for money and Lewis was very helpful and also another gentlemen. We won't hesitate to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly nice budget hotel at the right price”
Reviews.Author: HarryAngstrom1
Reviews.Content: Very small room but perfectly usable, with flat screen TV, tea & coffee making facilities. No complaints as it is priced correctly. There is a lot of noise from doors and corridors though so avoid if your sleep is easily disturbed

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Bloomsbury to see the sites!”
Reviews.Author: Patti W
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Mentone Hotel for three nights and found it to be a great location to sight-see. The hotel has been refurbished and our ensuite room was quite modern and clean. Because the hotel is on a side street, our sleep was sound. The typical, English breakfast is served in part by pleasant, very efficient waitresses; the rest of the items are on a buffet table. The diningroom is in need of updating for it looks pretty tired. We thought the cost per night a little expensive but anything cheaper had poor reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Mentone”
Reviews.Author: GwenOswestry
Reviews.Content: After booking we read some reviews and were a bit dubious about staying, but luckily we were pleasantly surprised as it wasn’t as bad as we expected. We stayed for 2 nights and were given a twin on the top floor (No Lift) the last flight of curved steps were narrow and steep. Room very clean and lovely shower room. Towels and bedding were fresh on the first day, but towels not replaced which we didn’t mind. Pity about the person in room 31, guest from hell, banging doors until 5am. The steps down to the eating area were also steep! Breakfast room was cramped and if you don’t arrive early you will have to queue at the bottom of the stairs. The breakfast choices were ok. Had scrambled egg first morning but this was cold so decided to stick to cereal and toast. Desk staff was very helpful. We were able to leave luggage until we were due to catch our train home. Location in Bloomsbury was close to Euston Station and the underground. Ideal for Brunswick Centre, Convent Garden and other sights and amenities within walking distance. All in all will probably stay again and give it another chance.

Reviews.Title: “Small, useful hotel”
Reviews.Author: ajmcgLeeds_UK
Reviews.Content: A friend and colleague recommended this hotel to me years ago, when committee meetings took me regularly to London. I've used it on a number of occasions, most recently in May 2011. It is conveniently sited within 5 minutes walk of King's Cross Station - though taxi drivers sometimes grumble because it's only a short "fare". The major hurdle for me, as someone who is mildly disabled, is the absence of a lift, but a request for a ground floor room for that cause is met without question whenever possible. The rooms vary in size and outlook, which is unavoidable in a building of this age, but I've never found it to be anything less than spotless and the staff are always professional. Though the standard of their friendliness does vary, I've never met anything approaching rudeness, and most are very helpful. Breakfast is a mixture of buffet and cooked, though the breakfast room could be a little bigger and can get a bit crowded sometimes. The biggest issue in finding somewhere in London is price, followed by and linked to locale and facilities. The kind of hotel that has a lift and room service is in a different price bracket; if I were staying in London for any length of time, I'd probably go to somewhere with more facilities and then grumble about the cost. If one's stay is no more than one through three nights then this is fair choice. For the price bracket that the Mentone is in, then it has the level of facilities that are usual, and overall is significantly better than average. I've stayed in places in this price-range that were nowhere near as pleasant. In the end, your experience will come down to expectation. If you expect a three or four star hotel, you'll not find it here; but if a one-to-two star guest house will meet your needs, then you will be more than satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “A tiny step above a youth hostel”
Reviews.Author: reptevia
Reviews.Content: The staff, especially Louis, were friendly and helpful. The breakfast was passable. The room was hot and uncomfortable. No A/C and based by the heaters in the store room, probably not very warm in winter. It is a old and not very well serviced boarding house. Pay more and get a real Hotel. Unless you're a college student who likes to party.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in London”
Reviews.Author: DmcG3_11
Reviews.Content: Was really worried after reading some of the reviews of this hotel but all worries were dispelled as soon as we arrived. Receptionist was very pleasant and allowed us to leave our luggage as we arrived earlier than check in time. When we returned our room was ready and was comfortable and clean. All staff were most helpful and friendly. Breakfast was prompt and hot. Excellent location - very convenient to Russell Square tube station. We checked out at allocated time but staff very kindly let us leave our luggage with them until we were leaving for the airport. Would most definitely recommend this hotel. Many thanks to staff

Reviews.Title: “It's OK!”
Reviews.Author: tatirlima
Reviews.Content: Don't fool yourself. Mentone is a B&B in a nice neighborhood. Bloomsbury is lovely - near to the British Museum, 20 minute walking from Soho, Picadilly Circus and Convent Garden, have nice pubs and a Waitrose. Don't get all excited about free wifi, though. Most of the time, you can't get a signal from the rooms and, as the front desk will tell you, there's nothing they can do about it.

Reviews.Title: “Handy and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Sally503975
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night and chose it because of it's close location to Kings Cross station - no long journey across London with suitcases. 5 mins walk from Russell Square tube station. The hotel was clean, functional and the breakfast was good. Located in a quiet crescent just off Euston Road. Recommended, would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel shame about the neighbours”
Reviews.Author: nessy213
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night booked via Late rooms and were given a twin on the top floor (No Lift). Room very clean and lovely shower room. towels and bedding fresh and new looking. Sadly no air conditioning and no fan in room. Extremely hot evening in London so had windows open until the neighbour from hell, living in a house behind the hotel started his party, with loud rap music and even louder guests. Noise was dreadful so shut window which made only small difference and then too hot in room for comfort. 'Party' continued till 5am dispite calls out of the window to the man from other irate hotel guests begging for peace. Didn't make it down for breakfast as we were too tired to get out of bed. Had to vacate room by 11 so all in all the worst night sleep of my life. I mentioned our situation to the receptionist who was pleasent but no refund offered. Will not be staying anywhere near Cartwright Gardens, Bloomsbury ever again and certainly begrudge paying £99 for a sleepless night.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, inexpensive some pros and cons”
Reviews.Author: GeneseeOhio
Reviews.Content: Our room was in the attic so the last flight of curved steps were a hazard. It was large but filled with a double and two twins so was difficult to negotiate especially since there was a step down to the door within a foot of a bed. Bathroom was modern. The breakfast choices were extensive but breakfast staff was abrupt. Desk staff was very helpful. Location in Bloomsbury was close to the underground . I was surprised that the crescent garden was not a garden but tennis courts.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: BennyBoy2010
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mentone for 3 nights, after once staying at the hotel a couple of years ago. Since then it has been refurbished and provides great value for money. My room was clean, the ensuite was modern and spacious, and most importantly it provided a great centrally located base to travel to my meetings.

Reviews.Title: “well recommended and very good value!!”
Reviews.Author: spiritesDerbyshire
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for New Year weekend and after reading some of these reviews was a bit dubious but was pleasantly suprised. We stayed in room 2 which ironically had the same picture on the wall we have at home!! Very comfirtable room. excellant maid service with clean towels daily and beds made. Nice and spacious but beware of the step into the bathroom it comes keen after a long days walking!! Fantastic breakfast all you can eat and as much toast as you want but the one criticism is the service was too fast we hadnt finished our cereals when our cooked appeared!! It made us feel rushed!!!! The steps down to the eating area were very steep I presume those less able would be catered for accordingly!! Excellant for commuting. If you are going to be in London for a few days buy a daily tube ticket worked out very good value for money!! Also an excellant pub called " The Rocket" on the same side as Kings Cross station where we got 3 meals and 5 beers for just over £20.00 so brill value!! Definetely be going back next New Year!!

Reviews.Title: “I stayed in better places on my trip”
Reviews.Author: GraceMockingbird
Reviews.Content: After a twenty-seven hour flight, my first time in London, I really didn't appreciate being snapped at by the woman at the front counter (and when she wasn't snapping she was grunting). I arrived early in the morning and left my bags at the counter, and thankfully when I returned at night a much friendlier man was there to greet me instead. There's no elevator and the stairs are narrow and steep, so a bit unpleasant with a 20kg suitcase, but the room turned out to be larger than I expected and had three beds (which was a little strange since I booked a single room for one, but I wasn't going to complain). It was very loud and bright until about midnight or so, but after that I had a good sleep. I stayed in four different hotels during my time in London, and this one ranked last in cost, comfort and service.

Reviews.Title: “If there's no other option, stay here; it's way overpriced for what you get.”
Reviews.Author: TampaBayb0b
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a 1 or 2-star hotel by U.S. standards. The website pics made it look better than it was. The price of over 400 GBP for two nights was absurd! We booked two rooms and were put in the attic. There was no elevator and the stairway was like a carpeted ladder, featuring narrow steps and an almost straight vertical incline. Unsafe for an elderly or unfit person. The overall appearance was rundown. The rooms were shabby with worn carpet, peeling paint and water stains on the ceiling. We wanted close to the British Museum, but there's better options nearer to it. The Tube is a 10 minute walk away. Breakfast room was cramped but the staff was good and the food was decent. Consider the Radisson near the Tower Bridge or another chain.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Carojan
Reviews.Content: The Mentone was a good hotel for it's class in London, and very well situated close to Kings Cross and Euston stations. Very clean and well-maintained, and breakfast was excellent, even if the dining room was a bit small & crowded. Only dificulty was that our room was on the top floor, and the stairs are very steep, so would not suit everyone. Generally though a good standard for as 2 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but beware; bugs”
Reviews.Author: cardinal64_10
Reviews.Content: My third time to stay in the Mentone Hotel--so convenient to the Picadilly Line and interesting neighborhood but encountered bed bugs this time. Apparently other guests have encountered the same problem. Won't ever stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “definitely no frills”
Reviews.Author: msbcat
Reviews.Content: the location is good - relatively quiet street not far from russell square, king's cross and st. pancras stations, and an easy to walk to most major tourist areas. overall we found the staff helpful and pleasant. breakfast staff also appears to be the cleaning/maid staff - they do a better job with breakfast than cleaning the rooms.- it didn't appear that the rooms were vacuumed terribly well, and we're not sure whether the beds were changed. the room was very plain, somewhat small but not cramped. the bathroom had been updated, but we had to run the hot water in the shower for several minutes before any hot water appeared. the shower rod/curtain also continuously fell down. the hotel doesn't provide any shampoo or skin lotion - only a tiny tiny tab of soap. no safe in the room, altho there is one at the reception desk. hair dryer available if you ask for it. if you stay here don't expect anything more than a place to sleep and you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be decived by the website - this is a shocker”
Reviews.Author: Austinvisitor
Reviews.Content: This place looks lovely on the webiste but the reality is not as bright. We arrived after a 30 hour trip from Australia early in the morning and were initially thrilled to find that a room was available immediately, This feeling of elation quickly dissipated when we clambered down the steep steps, over the painters drop sheets and plastic covered carpets to find the door of our room maked with tape. Inside the room was not nearly as spacious as on the web and in fact we struggled to find room for the suitcases and other stuff. The new bathroom was adequate but more than one tiny cake of soap would not seem too much when you are paying 90 pounds for a room. The surly girl on the desk gave us another, but rather unwillingly. I can't comment on breakfast as we didn't even bother. We went out to the nearby shops which are crowded with eateries and had a fantastic brekkie at the Giraffe. This hotel is in a great location with top restaurants really close. Look for the other hotels in Cartwright gardens. They may be better.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs”
Reviews.Author: Pl333p
Reviews.Content: Got a cellar room with a nice bathroom. Short walk to St. Pankras station. Free Wlan. But woke up biten by bedbugs. Check your room an your bed!

Reviews.Title: “We knew what to expect, and the hotel did not fail to offer it.”
Reviews.Author: dejoca
Reviews.Content: I went to London with a big group. We had several rooms in the hotel. The people at the reception were, overall, nice, and always seemed ready to help whenever we needed help. There were a few things that needed to be taken care of (towels needed to be changed; telephones that did not exist or did not work), but all was taken care of. It is a nice thing that they have hair dryers, just in case you need them, although not many. They also have electrical adapters, which is great if you come from another country in Europe. No one complained during the stay, apart from minor things that were, as I said, taken care of immediately. The furniture in the rooms looked, in some cases, a bit old, so they might need to change some of the pieces they have, but we did not notice anything radical. The English Breakfast was nice, there is a menu from which to choose from. The people waiting on us were nice. A sort of continental breakfast is also available, as you have toasts, butter, juice, milk, coffee or tea. A shame there was not any cheese or ham. There was also some fruit, although they could have a bit more to choose from. Cereals are also available. The check in and check out hours are also a plus (some other hotels have their check in too late and the check out too early). I do not know if I would fully consider it to be a hotel, as it seems like it is a big house transformed into a hotel. A sort of mixture between what a hotel is supposed to be and a Bed & Breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great value, clean and friendly. Recommended.”
Reviews.Author: MrsQNorthumberland
Reviews.Content: Our family of four had a quadruple room in the basement for two nights. I was pleasantly surprised by its size and bright, airy feel. The road outside was quiet and the location was brilliant for access to tube and train stations and buses. We were also able to walk to Oxford Street. The staff were cheerful and friendly, the children loved breakfast and being able to leave our bags in reception after we checked out was extremely useful. Great value for money for London, would definitely use again and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, very poor service”
Reviews.Author: Alvin034
Reviews.Content: I was there in Feb 2010 and the location and the rooms are great. But not the service. First, I had to wait every day 45 minutes to have a table for breakfast. Second, I had asked for a taxi early in the morning to catch a plane and it never arrived - I almost missed my flight since I had to look for a taxi at 445 in the morning across London. When I arrived home later that day, I called the hotel and gave a message to my parents who were still there to let them know I made it on time but I learned later that they never got the message.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Central London”
Reviews.Author: DS15
Reviews.Content: Room was clean and tidy; staff were very helpful and friendly. Manager was on the other end of the phone when I needed to get directions and when I arrived very late. Rooms are a little noisy - I took ear plugs and was fine. Good value all round; comfortable and clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: k_mlly
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel rooms and interiors were not modern, it was very clean, had nice size rooms, warm, provided breakfast options and ina reasonable quite street overlooking a green area. Only a 5 minute walk to the Euston and Russell square undersgrounds. Very Conveniently located to Great ormond street hosipital only a 10 minute walk. There is a shopping center nearby were waitrose, boots, restaurants, and other shops are Situated. A very nice Indian (good value) is located on leighs street close to the hotel but there are other restaurants of similar rating within walking distance. The only trouble we had was the ensuite shower did not work properly and possibly due to the age of the building the floor boards moved alot and were noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a Manager. TV, sidelamp not working. Coffee is appauling.”
Reviews.Author: ReadingWhocares
Reviews.Content: After 2 different rooms the TV freeview is just not working. I also had problems with the internet otherwise the location is the only reason to choose it. The breakfast is ok, but the coffee is so weak and crap you need to leave for a decent cup.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - Cramped Quarters”
Reviews.Author: CoastMississippi
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mentone for 3 nights during New Years Eve and no one told us that they didn't have an elevator. We were on the third floor - no help with luggage - and you could barely walk around the room. The bathroom was extremely small, too. We asked to switch rooms but no luck there.

Reviews.Title: “Close your eyes its exactly where you want to be!!!”
Reviews.Author: shinners0
Reviews.Content: Arrived on Friday the 13th should have known it wouldn't be a good thing!!! When we arrived the girl on duty was a bit dozy and not very welcoming took her about 20 minutes to find our booking even after writhing our name down and giving her the booking reference. One of our two rooms was ready (we were early) we decided to dump our cases there so she led us to the stairs .. no lift 5 girls 7 cases ... a new carpet was being laid so we had to lug our stuff around two workmen, a loose unsecured carpet and visible nails!!! When we got back that evening the men appeared to be gone but the carpet was not complete, two portions of the stairs where not completed during our stay, one directly outside our door where nails where clearly visible and highly dangerous!!! Our second room was ready at this stage but it required us to take our cases down one flight of stairs and up another at the other side of the hotel ... all the way to the attic!!!! Literally!!! The bathroom in our double room served its purpose but overall the room could benefit from a lick of paint and modernized bed coverings. Cleaners came on Saturday morning but we were only up she gave us plenty of fresh towels and toilet rool.

Reviews.Title: “Got the big things right, not the little”
Reviews.Author: jschwa1
Reviews.Content: Had booked a single room - got a triple - Result! Room clean and tidy and well maintained. No biscuits, shower gel, towel rail, soap dish in shower etc. so a bit of a let down here. Good service at breakfast and food good, but unimaginative. For central London - good value, good location

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Bibi1209
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Menton Hotel London for 3 nights and I must say I was positively surprised because some reviews I had read were very negative. Location is superb, the hotel is within short walking distance to 3 stations and the area is also well served by buses, so it is easy to get to the sights and to airports, too. And it is off the main street so it is not very noisy. We were welcomed by a very friendly receptionist who was willing to change our reservation on arrival without any penalty or other fees. The room we got was a quad room (for 3 people) and was big enough for 3 adults (not sure for 4, though). Bathroom (big enough) and rooms were clean and neat. On Saturday night there was some noise from the street at night, but we had known before our arrival that students live in this area, so we actually expected worse. We were a bit disappointed by breakfast. It wasn't horrible, but a canned tomato is not appropriate, I think. Most ladies serving breakfast were nice and efficient. It is suggested, however, to go for breakfast early, as we had to queue for about 10 mins when we came at 8:30. Bigger breakfast room is definitely needed and improvement to breakfast, too. We could leave our luggage in the hotel on the day of our departure. We definitely will book the hotel again when we travel to London. It is not luxury, but comfortable enough and very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “much better than expected...”
Reviews.Author: mezzosopranoMilano
Reviews.Content: I had read all the reviews and didn't quite know what to expect but..I was pleasantly surprised. The room was quite large, the bathroom adequate, everything very clean. Breakfast a bit limited. Staff very friendly and helpful. Location great!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay there”
Reviews.Author: arthur990
Reviews.Content: My family and I had a "triple" room (two beds, each only a little larger than a single) for 4 nights from December 27th 2008. The room was dirty and the tiny bathroom had no hot water except for the last morning. The explanation given at reception was that the hotel was old. On the website there is a picture of the entrance showing an AA three star recommendation. However, that is totally false. The hotel is actually only two star. The interior is somewhat dilapidated and untidy. The only positive thing was the breakfast. The breakfast room, however, was freezing cold. I would certainly never go back to the Mentone Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible, and very rude receptionist.”
Reviews.Author: droidy
Reviews.Content: Probably the worst hotel I've been in for a while. No hot water in the room all night and morning, grumpy and stoned staff, aggressive receptionist, a breakfast consisting of a tea spoon of egg smeared across a slice of damp white bread served by surly staff with stained ripped t shirts. Just don't do it.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for short stay”
Reviews.Author: Dave_Oz
Reviews.Content: My second time at the Mentone in a month. Had a small single ensuite on the second floor, facing the street. Shower is under the stairs, so a little bit cramped for headroom - I'm not sure why they didn't opt for a hose fitting. The bed was verging on uncomfortable, and the "pillow" was below average. Beware of late night street noise from the student accommodation across the gardens (a bit of a hazard in this part of town), though they do try to keep it down in the wee small hours. Otherwise, I've had trouble-free stays at the Mentone; the staff have been friendly and low key, and it's been fine for a short stay in this part of town which is handy to transport.

Reviews.Title: “not bad, but....”
Reviews.Author: braveheart50
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the mentone hotel for 5 nights end of august as a single traveler. i was given a room in the basement, actually a 2 beds room, not bad in itself, but irrationally furnished: big chest of drawers, big wardrobe (few hangers) 2 beds and 2 night tables occupied all the space of the room. i could manage being the only occupant, but what if there were 2? not a chair, not a clothes-hook, badly placed sockets. tiny but proper bathroom. room can be much better with a few easy and cheap improvements and more rational furniture. TV didn't work, i asked the staff to see about that which they didn't do, i asked again next day: no way. so i gave up. staff in the breakfast room should be trained to properly do their job and try to smile at customers. organization was lacking: milk coming jug by jug, croissants coming three by three, and people waiting for the jugs to be refilled: again not big defaults, actually, but lack of care and attention. don't forget to take ear-plugs with you, at least up to when the kitchen staff is taught not to bang doors or speak loudly at 6 in the morning. on the whole a basic hotel, very conveniently placed, good enough if you are not fussy and just mean to use it as a place to sleep in.

Reviews.Title: “Basic enough...but not bad,”
Reviews.Author: flame01
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night, on Wednesday 18th June 2008.I arrived at approx 3PM, the lady on reception, was very friendly and check in was smooth with no problems. The reception area was "messy" and appeared not to be well kept, with lots of office equipment and around the place My room was a single room (Number 24) which faced the street. To say it was small would not be a lie, but it was functional, very clean and did the job. The bathroom was spotless and appeared to be newly renovated. Only down side was the timber which appeared to be rotting on the base of the window. The supplied kettle had to be plugged into a power adapter which was on the floor at the window Breakfast is served in the basement and was cooked to order, very pleasent indeed, but the only problem was, at 0915 the line waiting to get a free table for breakfast was going up the stairs and took about 20 minutes to clear. Breakfast is served till 1000 and I guess everyone left it very late to rise. Staff working in the breakfast area were very pleasent and hard working. This property has no air conditioning, the weather for my stay was not to hot, but still meant having to leave the window open for fresh air, and traffic noise was not too bad from the outside On checking out on the morning of 19th June, the receptionist went out of her way to give me directions to a question I raised. There is no doubt that this hotel could do with a makeover, some rooms / areas appear to be excellent yet some are very worn looking and in obvious need of repair. Maybe the premises is undergoing a slow renovation...I do not know, but one thing is for sure...With a new decor, and the staff currently emloyed, I feel that this premises could be a gem..pity about the small single room though I got the underground to Kings Cross, exited onto Euston Road walking right when I came out of the underground station and was in the hotel in 5 minutes Overall, a pleasent experience, but a very small room

Reviews.Title: “A place to avoid!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: paolorandazzo
Reviews.Content: I just return from a trip to London. I am Hotel owner here in Italy and I highly recommend to avoid this hotel, we book a quad room which was really dirty , furniture was really old!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great setting; too much noise”
Reviews.Author: Travelover02
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in several hotels on Cartwright Gardens. It is a pretty area and a great street in Bloomsbury that is close to the tube and lots of restaurants and pubs. This hotel is neither better nor worse than other hotels on this street. However, I was disturbed on two nights at 4am by rowdy men (celebrating a football win) in the hallway and in the room next to mine. This is a big problem for a hotel and one this hotel needs to deal with by establishing clear rules about noise after 11pm. These men should have been kicked out of the hotel. Unfortunately, what is unaffectionately referred to as "lager louts" is a serious problem in England (and other parts of Europe), and a particular problem for older hotels where the walls are quite thin.

Reviews.Title: “Poorly decorated, badly organised breakfast, room furniture awful.”
Reviews.Author: nevernevernever
Reviews.Content: 6 Senior Citizens visited London and stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. We had rooms on ground floor. They were noisy with people coming and going all the time. Furniture was very poor in the room and the wardrobe swayed when putting clothes in it. Bathroom cabinet in sore need of painting and was missing a handle ! Breakfast was badly organised with a shortage of glasses , bowls cereals and juice at various times. Breakfast itself when it arrived was reasonable. It was totally haphazard. Not a place to be recommended.

Reviews.Title: “average...”
Reviews.Author: ballyhooOopNorth
Reviews.Content: The staff were very helpful and friendly. the room was average but really uncomfortable bed- rock hard. Kettle and lamp broken. Okay but wouldn't go there again.

Reviews.Title: “A place to avoid”
Reviews.Author: HongkongWesterner
Reviews.Content: As many other reviewers have reported, this hotel is shabby. The room was small and smelly. A pane of glass in the window was broken, and the window frame was impossible to close. That meant the room was always very cold, a particular problem as the weather outside was freezing and it was sometimes snowing. I reported the problem at reception on the morning after I arrived. They said they would "look at it". Maybe they did, but they took no action , even though I was there for a week. They turn off the heating in the daytime, which made matters worse. It was unbearably cold between breakfast time and early evening. Speaking of breakfast, the breakfast room was inadequate. People had to queue all the way up the staircase outside to get a table, as breakfast was only being served for 90 minutes a day. Having said that, the food (when you could get it) was acceptable, and the workers did their best to cope with the crowd of irritated guests. The walls of the rooms are paper-thin, which provides no privacy and makes them very noisy. I could hear every word my neighbours were saying in their room. Also, the hotel's website says it accepts credit cards, but the agency I booked through told me I had to pay in cash when I booked. But I guess that, since they had the "hotel full" notice at the entrance up all the time I was there, they do not care about their poor quality. In summary, I read the reviews before I went there. But I went hoping for the best, while fearing the worst. My experience was more of the "worst" than the "best". The location is the only thing to commend the place.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Good value.”
Reviews.Author: Peripatetical
Reviews.Content: I've always said that Trip Advisor reviews tend towards the two extremes. They either love it or hate it. We've been staying at the Menrone since 1980 and we love the place. The location can't be beaten, the staff is helpful and the price is right. We've watched the management pass from the inimitable Glynnys Tyner to her son, Simon, with constant changes and upgradings. Yes, the single rooms are small. If you want a large single room, book a double! I've recommended the Mentone to lots of friends and no one had ever complained. The neighborhood is interesting and the best fish and chips house in London is right up the street.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely find another...”
Reviews.Author: cockyp
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night as a late booking. Yes, the location is good being close to Euston, Bloomsbury etc. but this hotel isn't great. The staff were warm and welcoming and the breakfast was good... but this does not make up for the lack of a lift, the highly dangerous stairs to the top floor... and the very noisy students. I had a room on the top floor and had to negotiate the stairs with a case and laptop bag... not easy and found the carpet almost dangerous. The room itself was average size and quite clean... and had basic ensuite facilities... but this alone does not improve the basic decor and tatty hallways and dangerous access to rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Find something else”
Reviews.Author: withwill
Reviews.Content: Ok so the location is great and you can walk into the west end in about 20 min and the trees are nice but it kind of ends there. My single room was tiny and as others have mentioned up an almost dangerous staircase which was not easy with a large suitcase and be warned once again, no lift. The room was small, with tv, miniscule bathroom (one of those stepout of the shower and you are in the toilet jobs) and the sloping floor did not drain the water from the shower properly so the floor was always wet. It looked like it hadn't been cleaned properly and I really didn't want to get into the bed. Smoke lingered in the hotel. The breakfast was ok, but service was very slow. Find something else, lots of hotels in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't go back”
Reviews.Author: ghollandy
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel rather disappointing and felt for the money we could have done alot better. Location was good, a few minutes from Russell Square tube, but the location of the room was on the top floor, no lift , narrow steep winding staircases and very precarious loose carpet in some places. Despite offering a 12.30 check in our room was not ready at 1.00 and we were sent away for 20 minutes. When we returned we were checked in but when we got to our room the cleaner refused us entry as she hadn't finished getting it ready. Being strict non-smokers, the wafting of the smell of smoke through this 'non-smoking' hotel was frustrating and irritating. The staff were however friendly, and the breakfast was very good. The room was on the whole clean, if not very basic, but the shower room could have been cleaner. The TV had no picture and the kettle's on off switch was missing and it looked rather unsafe!

Reviews.Title: “Would never stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: histtrav
Reviews.Content: I booked the Mentone because it was very close to where I was working, it had free Wifi, and their website claimed it to be a non-smoking hotel. Two out three of these things turned out to be true. Since I was traveling alone, I booked a single which was an enormous mistake as these rooms are at the top of a very narrow, twisty staircase. My biggest gripe with the room was not its lack of amenities - when I say lack, I mean lack, ie. no towels on some days, the tv barely worked, tea never replaced, etc. My problem with the room was that it was so smoky that I felt like I had smoked two pack of cigarettes each morning. People smoked through the night and having an open window did not help ventilate the room. The rooms on the top floor are to be avoided at all costs!!! Additionally, be warned - this is an area full of students so if you face the front of the hotel, it will be very loud in the evening. The full English breakfast is not my thing so I cannot comment on it. The Mentone is inexpensive and conveniently located in Bloomsbury but if you don't want lung cancer - avoid it.

Reviews.Title: “Give it a chance!”
Reviews.Author: FrankWirral
Reviews.Content: I always find London hotel prices a bit strange - you just never know what to expect for your money. The Mentone is a great value budget hotel - nothing more nothing less! I've stayed here 3 times now and have just spent a short break with my mother. Rooms are clean and en suite, with tea and coffee making facilities. OK so service can be a little brusque but it has a great location (10 minute walk from Euston railway station and close to the British Museum and theatreland). Some rooms may be small but I know I'd rather pay these prices and be able to spend more 'on the town'.

Reviews.Title: “It won't kill you”
Reviews.Author: zardoz1
Reviews.Content: I just needed a cheap room for one night and this hotel met that need, without any serious problem. If your needs extend much beyond that, though, you might want to think about it more carefully. These tiny rooms are not for sufferers of claustrophobia. Nor are they for people looking for a week or more of comfortable accomodation. But if you just want to stay a day or two in London, this place will be good enough. The room was clean enough, there was hot water, the bed was OK, the breakfast was actually quite good, the service was OK. Noise is always a problem in these old buildings - squeaky floorboards, doors and windows that don't keep noise out - and this place was typical in that regard. (I always travel with good-quality earplugs now, and the problem goes away.) The noise level was not above average for this type of hotel. I was in a top floor room (just under the roof) and it was hot. No airconditioning... That may be a serious problem if you're staying in summer. And, the location was first-class - just around the corner from the British Museum and Bloomsbury. The streets around the hotel have a good selection of cafes and pubs (from the cheap-and-cheerful to the posh). Public transport is everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good, no complaints”
Reviews.Author: aribari
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. Close to Euston, Kings Cross, and center, yet in a very quiet area. For the ones who prefer public transport, the tube is at a stone's throw. We preferred walking :) After staying at several hotels in London, I would say that rooms are not smaller than the average. There is no elevator, and stairs are a bit steep. This might represent problem to elder people. Room and bathroom are clean. Internet connection is stable. Plentiful choices for breakfast. Helpful and knowledgeable staff.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Kivvy&theElf
Reviews.Content: Booked for one night, and dont know what the fuss is about! This hotel must be one of Londons best kept secrets. close to Euston station in a quiet area off the main drag. Clean and bright all the way thru, from the top floor where we were to the breakfast room in the basement. Beautifully clean and stylish en suite room was more than adequate and a bargain for the £65 for the two of us including breakfast which consisted of a cold table and a full english with unlimited tea and coffee. Nice to see kids being catered for too, as well as business people. Would definately highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “If you like a shower, stay clear of this hotel”
Reviews.Author: TrishCapeTown
Reviews.Content: First impression of this hotel is a warning. Torn carpets, shabby furniture and peeling paint. Reception staff are very unhelpful. My room was extremely tiny and bedcover had brown stains. Shower hot water not available on two days. Was told by reception that I should wait until someone else had finished showering! Breakfast items not always available. Only white bread served. Menu offers croissants but these were never displayed. Serving staff could not speak English very well and did not understand breakfast orders. Hotel impossible for anyone with heavy luggage as there are no lifts and many, many stairs. I will not be returning there!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for a Business Trevaller”
Reviews.Author: anilchadda
Reviews.Content: Have been visiting Mentone for the last two years, I travel for work and generally stay for 8-10 days at a stretch. Mentone provides a FREE WIFI in the room, this makes communication with the office very seamless and smooth. The staff is friendly, the rooms clean and Breakfast too good. I would recommend this to all Business and Holiday makers.

Reviews.Title: “Yes, it's a dump”
Reviews.Author: thegeesta
Reviews.Content: Noisy Smelly Rude Staff Paint peeling off walls No ironing board Perfect if you like scabby rooms and don't want to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “A Dump!”
Reviews.Author: nuhaus
Reviews.Content: For the price, it's centrally located and the staff was pleasant but that is all I can say about it. My room was tiny (which i'm used to in london hotels) but FILTHY and very run down. There were cig burn holes in the bedspread! a DUMP.

Reviews.Title: “Mentone Hotel OK...”
Reviews.Author: Jalopee
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Mentone for 4 nights in late Sept 2006, and the accomodations were fine; nothing more and nothing less. I did a bunch of research, and we settled on the Mentone due to favorable reviews, affordable rate, and location. For starters, the location is in terrific proximity to the tube. I'd recommend it for the combination of affordability and easy accessibility to everything. The room left a lot to be desired, but then again, this is not a 5-star hotel and it's not advertised as such. It was clean enough, and it was a huge plus to have a private bathroom! We were not interested in sharing a bathroom! The breakfast was included and was a huge bonus price-wise. London is pricey, so it was nice to get a meal to start our day. We're not gourmet breakfast-eaters, so the selections were adequate for us. The employees were nice enough. I wouldn't call them warm or especially welcoming, but they were helpful when we needed help, and they were responsive to inquiries and requests for recommendations. The neighborhood seemed safe enough. It was a rather deserted area at night, and I probably wouldn't have felt comfortable walking alone after dark, but I felt safe with my husband. We didn't see anything unsafe or even questionable; it's just not a "happening" place like some of the other areas and therefore sort of desolate-feeling at night! We had a fabulous time in London! The accomodations certainly didn't make our trip fabulous. But, the affordability of our accomodations (and the fact that the accomodations were clean and accessible), made us relax and enjoy spending $ on other things such as the theatre, amazing Indian restaurants, trips to Cambridge, etc. In summary, the Mentone is a good place if you're looking simply for an affordable place to crash.

Reviews.Title: “Very Basic But Well Located”
Reviews.Author: Cassowary
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is very well located close to the Russell St Tube Station and just a little further from the Kings Cross Station. We are a family of 4 and booked a Quad Room - one tiny room with a double and 2 single beds. The room was serviceable and clean and we were surprised that our towels were changed daily. Full English breakfast was included and was served in the dining room by very helpful and friendly staff - the food was plentiful and enough variety was available to satisfy our picky children! The Hotel must be in a quiet area of town as we did not have any noise problems (not even traffic noise) on any of our 3 night stay. However, there were some things which were a little disappointing. Firstly, the beds are extremely uncomfortable - very hard and unyielding. The sheets are clean but show signs of wear. The other bed linen (duvet, quilt) were clean but worn and stained. The bathroom does not have an extractor fan and the knob on the cold water tap kept falling off. There was no bar fridge provided. Finally, while the meals staff were lovely, neither of the two Reception people we encountered were particularly friendly or helpful.

Reviews.Title: “can't go wrong for the price”
Reviews.Author: AJP-Tokyo
Reviews.Content: Free wi-fi, breakfast included. The showers run hot. Beds cleans. Staff helpful. Walking distance even with luggage from subway, or Euston/Kings Cross trains stations. Rooms are pretty much student dorm or cheap bedsit, but for the price it's be best in London. Can get cheaper than the hotel website, but even that price is great for the location and facilities. I've stayed there a few times and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: remainder3
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, together with our 3 boys, had a great time at the Mentone. We had two rooms, just off the main stairwell, through a firedoor, and as they were the only two rooms there, it was like having a suite. In the daytime we could wedge the doors open (they faced each other) so we could keep an eye on the kids whilst still retaining some privacy of our own. In the night time we could lock their door and relax in the knowledge that they were only just across the small "private" hallway. The breakfasts have been written about before and we can confirm a 10/10 score here. One criticism, is that there was no place to leave your bags once you had checked out. Not really their problem I suppose, but most places have somewhere secure to leave your stuff if your flight is later on in the day. All in all, The Mentone is great for tube links, fairly central and the neighbourhood seemed really safe - the 24 hour Tesco is good as well. Oh and if you use the hotel's transfer from the airport ask for the Polish guy Matthew, a great bloke! Pete & Michelle, Guernsey, Channel Islands

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, Cheerful and Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: JackRoy
Reviews.Content: Good location with easy access to Kings Cross/St Pancras Station or Russell Square. Clean, big rooms with a decent shower (although the water was boiling hot with out any way of turning it down!) but the main reason for staying is the cost in relation to hotels nearby. If you are only staying for a night or two then this is ideal as it has everything you need and is in an ideal location to base from. For business people, if your company is on a budget then this is a good option and preferable to a travelinn/lodge etc.
